original_text:
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP-CODE
**NAME[AAA] JR , **NAME[BBB M]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A4B/435
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ]
NEWCOMER
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Nov 22 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[Nov 29 2007]
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS :
Acute hip fracture .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Acute hip fracture .
2. Insulin - dependent diabetes mellitus .
3. Depression .
4. Borderline hypertension .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient is a **AGE[in 20s]- year - old white male who presented as he had a fall , no syncope , but he was riding on his dirt bike , fell , sustained a left hip fracture and seen in consultation by orthopedics , and he had an ORIF of the hip , tolerated well .
His glucose has remained stable .
He required coverage at times .
He did very well , finally ambulating with a walker at home where he lives with his sister .
Home care was consulted for physical therapy upon discharge .
He will follow up with Dr. **NAME[YYY] in 2 weeks for his regular care and followup .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Vicodin q.i.d. #60 given p.r.n. pain .
2. Fluoxetine 40 mg daily .
3. Lantus 30 units subcu daily .
4. Neurontin 300 t.i.d.
5. His Accupril was discontinued .
Other relevant hospital laboratory work , he had an EKG done which was normal .
His electrolytes , BUN and creatinine were normal .
H and H were normal .
White blood cell count was also normal , and his followup hip x-ray showed good alignment after ORIF .
___________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , D.O.
Dict :
**DATE[Nov 29 2007] 09:05:19
Tran :
**DATE[Nov 29 2007] 10:24:27
MPH/ss/365960/**ID-NUM/**ID-NUM
R :
**DATE[Nov 29 2007] 10:24:27/ss
**CARBON-COPY
